## Description {#details}

Helper class for managing resource cleanups.

<ParametersList title="Template Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="T"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> of resource been reclaimed.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Cleanup">Class that defines how the resource is reclaimed.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
Clients create objects of this type in the code executed in a crash recovery context to ensure that the resource will be reclaimed even in the case of crash. For example:


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> actual&#95;work(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;Resource&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscvfencefield/#a147be9e9780c1e33363ea572d4c7b25fa1835091d83e0e052cd1a32c99b2be731">R</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">new</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Resource());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a22b2744432d950424a79cce9424ff02e">CrashRecoveryContextCleanupRegistrar</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a6a9f043784cf87001c84980afa76da82">D</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscvfencefield/#a147be9e9780c1e33363ea572d4c7b25fa1835091d83e0e052cd1a32c99b2be731">R</a>.get());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> foo() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  CrashRecoveryContext CRC;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!CRC.RunSafely(actual&#95;work, 0)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">     ... a crash was detected, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/memprof/anonymous-memprofreader-cpp-/#a5aa1da33006dea5aabda2768e34787b8">report</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/debuginfo/lib/debuginfo/codeview/symbolrecordmapping-cpp/#a9cdf893c7d17e47fa1ed8bebf92a5da4">error</a> to user ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

If the code of <code>actual&#95;work</code> in the example above does not crash, the destructor of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontextcleanupregistrar">CrashRecoveryContextCleanupRegistrar</a> removes cleanup code from the current <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext">CrashRecoveryContext</a> and the resource is reclaimed by the destructor of std::unique&#95;ptr. If crash happens, destructors are not called and the resource is reclaimed by cleanup object registered in the recovery context by the constructor of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontextcleanupregistrar">CrashRecoveryContextCleanupRegistrar</a>.

Definition at line 252 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/crashrecoverycontext-h">CrashRecoveryContext.h</a>.
